features: ZIPPERED CLOSURE: fully encases your pillow
MACHINE WASH: Conveniently machine washable for easy care and a clean, healthy bedroom

body.description: The Sealy Soft Comfort Pillow Protector features a dobby stripe pattern and is made of ultra-soft 100% cotton fabric. The 200-thread count cotton is cool and breathable for a more restful night’s sleep. Sealy pillow protectors extend the life of your pillow by adding a protective layer between your pillowcase and pillow, keeping it clean and fresh. It is machine washable for easy care and continued use. Trusted quality backed by the Sealy Lifetime Warranty.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Exactly what I was looking for
reviews.reviewText: Previous pillow protectors I ordered made a crinkling noise when my head moved. Apparently it was the water proofing material in them. These are perfect, not too thick or too thin and soft 109% cotton. Size is good and wash well. Will purchase more.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars *Nice, lightweight, 100% cotton pillow protectors that come in Sealy packaging*
reviews.reviewText: I think these are quite nice, lightweight, quality Sealy pillow protectors...to me, they're like an almost "medium" type of thickness...I have cotton pillow protectors that are thicker than these (which are similar to an almost cotton "canvas" type of thickness, but are softer than canvas material, & they're more for "allergy" protection)...and I also have bamboo pillow protectors that are slightly thinner than these, which are good for Summertime use to keep my pillow cooler. So I think these Sealy pillow protectors are a good "in between" type of quality, lightweight thickness if you aren't looking for real thick pillow protectors! :)These aren't meant to provide "allergy protection" but using even thin/lightweight pillow protectors is better than using none at all. I haven't washed these yet to put them on my king size pillow yet, but I held them up to my pillow & they seem to be an adequate size to fit the pillow, but my king size pillow isn't an overly thick one either. I think these are nice-looking, good quality pillow protectors that seem well made...the zipper is a quality metal zipper (not plastic) & it opened & closed easily on both pillow protectors & none of the pillow cover gets snagged in the zipper while opening & closing it.There's tags inside of both pillow covers stating they're 100% cotton & showing they're Sealy made (& apparently made in the U.S.A. in Pennsylvania, so that's great!!) They come wrapped in Sealy plastic & in sealed paperboard Sealy packaging with a Sealy card inside to contact Sealy if you have an issues with the product, etc. So you can be sure these are indeed made by Sealy!The washing instructions are on the tags & say warm water wash & dry on low heat. If you're worried about them shrinking, I'd say to wash them on cool water the first time you wash them instead of warm. (I've learned that sometimes washing cotton items on cool water the first time kind of "pre-washes/preps" them so that they're less likely to shrink as much when I do wash them in warm water in future washings.)I think these are very nice pillow protectors if you want lightweight ones for Spring/Summer/Fall use or if you just don't like a thicker/bulky pillow covers! :) They have a stylish "striped" pattern to their fabric that makes them look a bit more "fancy" than just plain/solid white pillow covers.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars High-quality pillow protector that's both comfortable and effective
reviews.reviewText: If you're looking for a reliable pillow protector, the Sealy Soft Comfort Pillow Protector is definitely worth considering. This 2-pack of jumbo protectors is made from 100% cotton fabric with a dobby stripe pattern that not only looks great but also feels incredibly soft to the touch.One of the standout features of this pillow protector is its zipper closure that fully encases your pillow. This provides an added layer of protection against allergens, dust mites, and other irritants that can accumulate over time, keeping your pillow clean and fresh for longer. The 200-thread count cotton fabric is also breathable, ensuring a cool and comfortable night's sleep.The Sealy Soft Comfort Pillow Protector is conveniently machine washable, making it easy to maintain and care for. It's an affordable way to extend the life of your pillow and protect your investment. Plus, with a lifetime warranty from Sealy, you can rest easy knowing that you've made a trusted choice.Compared to other pillow protectors on the market, the Sealy Soft Comfort Pillow Protector stands out for its high-quality construction and attention to detail. The 100% cotton fabric is a significant selling point for those who prioritize breathability and comfort. However, some might find that the zipper closure can be a bit stiff at first and requires some breaking in.In my personal experience using the Sealy Soft Comfort Pillow Protector, I found that it does an excellent job of keeping my pillow clean and fresh. The fabric is soft and comfortable, and the zipper closure is effective at preventing allergens from getting into my pillow. I appreciate that it's easy to care for and maintain, and the lifetime warranty gives me peace of mind that I've made a good investment.Overall, if you're in the market for a high-quality pillow protector that's both comfortable and effective, the Sealy Soft Comfort Pillow Protector is definitely worth checking out. Its 100% cotton fabric, zipper closure, and machine washable convenience make it a standout choice in the crowded pillow protector market

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Good quality pillow ticks. I like the extra layer of comfort with a pillow cover in between my pillow and outer pillow case. Protect your pillow and make it last longer!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 26, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Besides the fact that they had weird stains (ink? charcoal? potentially burn marks as the fabric seemed to degrade in quality at the center of the stain?) one of the pillow cases didn’t even have a zipper.
